hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'What an excellent man is Uwayy ibn Sa'idah, may Allah be pleased with him.'

potential_issues.issue: Suhayl ibn Abi Salih uses 'an (عَنْ) despite being known for weak memory
potential_issues.impact: Suhayl ibn Abi Salih is considered Saduq (truthful) but with concerns about his memorization. The indirect transmission term 'an reduces clarity of the connection.

potential_issues.issue: Multiple indirect transmission terms in the chain
potential_issues.impact: The chain contains three 'an connections (Suhayl from Abi Salih, Abi Salih from Abu Hurayrah, Abu Hurayrah from the Prophet ﷺ), which collectively weaken the transmission clarity.

potential_issues.issue: Yaqub ibn Humayd has limited biographical data
potential_issues.impact: This narrator appears to be majhul al-hal (unknown in condition) with minimal information available in classical hadith sources.

Topics: Character praise for Uwayy ibn Sa'idah
Description of a righteous companion

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ubaydah, daughter of Uwayy ibn Sa'idah: Umar ibn al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, stood at the grave of Uwayy ibn Sa'idah and said: 'No one from the people of the earth can say that anyone is better than the one in this grave. Whenever a flag was raised for the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, Uwayy ibn Sa'idah, may Allah be pleased with him, was beneath its shadow.'

narrators.full_name: Yaqub ibn Humayd ibn Rafi' al-Muqtadi

Topics: Praise of Uwayy ibn Sa'idah by Umar ibn al-Khattab
Excellence of a companion in military campaigns
Description of honorable lineage and service

hadiths.english_translation: Chain 1 (Mawquf): Narrated that Uwayy ibn Sa'idah, may Allah be pleased with him, said to his companions when they were sent against the hypocrites in the house of Suylam: 'Obey me and burn them with fire as the Messenger of Allah ﷺ commanded you.' Chain 2 (Marfu'): Narrated by the grandson of Uwayy ibn Sa'idah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Verily, Allah has chosen me and chosen for me companions. He made from them ministers, in-laws, and helpers. Whoever curses them - upon him is the curse of Allah, the angels, and all people. Allah will not accept from him any compensation or recompense on the Day of Resurrection.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Uwayy ibn Sa'idah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'You must marry virgin women, for they have sweeter mouths, more productive wombs, and are more satisfied with less. And verily the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Verily Allah the Mighty and Majestic has sent me with guidance and the true religion, and He did not make me a farmer, nor a merchant, nor a crier in the markets. Rather He placed my sustenance beneath the shadow of my spear.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Asim (grandfather): I and my brother bought one hundred shares from the shares of Khaybar. News of this reached the Prophet ﷺ, and he said: 'O Asim, two predatory wolves attacking a flock of sheep do not corrupt it more than a man's love of wealth and status corrupts his faith.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Asim ibn Adi's father: He heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ when he arrived in Medina asking about a Habashi person called Sayl. He said: Abui passed by him while he was in his house, and said: Where is your family? He said: At Habash Sayl. The Prophet ﷺ said: Take your sandal and garment and go to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. He said: O Messenger of Allah, this person is from Habash Sayl. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: Where did you leave your family? He said: At Habash Sayl. The Prophet ﷺ said: Go to your family, for the Hour will not be established until a fire comes out from it like the necks of camels, illuminating from it. He said: I think he said: From Busra.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Asim al-Ajlani to Umar ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf: Your father was wealthy. What wealth did he leave you? He said: Much good. He said: Should I not teach you what is better for you than your inheritance from your father? I said: Yes. He said: No elevated character for a faultfinder, no wealth for a careless person, and slaves are beauty, not wealth. For you regarding wealth is what sustains you, not what sustains it.
